title: 48 Second Averaged Interplanetary Magnetic Field - Adam Szabo (NASA GSFC)

info.x_cadence_note: Counts based on variable 'Epoch' in https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/sp_phys/data/voyager/voyager1/magnetic_fields_cdaweb/mag_48s/1977/voyager1_48s_mag_19770905_v02.cdf. The most common cadence, 48000 [ms] = PT48S, occurred for 94.2231% of the 3996 timesteps.

parameters.name: F1
parameters.description: B-Magnitude by Method 1 (F1): 48 second average of 9.6 second magnitudes

parameters.name: F2
parameters.description: B-Magnitude by Method 2 (F2): average derived from 48 second component averages=sqrt(B1**2+B2**2+B3**2)

parameters.name: B1
parameters.description: BR (B1): 48 second average of 9.6 second averages of the B-radial component in HG coords

parameters.name: B2
parameters.description: ---> BT (B2): 48 second average of 9.6 second averages of the B-tangential component in HG coords

parameters.name: B3
parameters.description: ---> BN (B3): 48 second average of 9.6 second averages of the B-normal component in HG coords

parameters.name: F1_100nt
parameters.description: [100nT plot scale] B-Magnitude by Method 1 (F1): 48 second average of 9.6 second magnitudes. This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function alternate_view (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['F1']. Note that some COMPONENTS may not be available from the HAPI interface. They are accessible from the raw CDF files, however.

parameters.name: F2_100nt
parameters.description: ---> B-Magnitude by Method 2 (F2): average derived from 48 second component averages=sqrt(B1**2+B2**2+B3**2). This variable is a 'virtual' variable that is computed using the function alternate_view (see https://cdaweb.gsfc.nasa.gov/pub/software/cdawlib/source/virtual_funcs.pro) on the with inputs of the variables ['F2']. parameters.name: RMSB1
parameters.description: RMS of BR

parameters.name: RMSB2
parameters.description: ---> RMS of BT

parameters.name: RMSB3
parameters.description: ---> RMS of BN

parameters.name: x
parameters.description: V1 X position in IHG coords
parameters.x_cdf_FIELDNAM: V1 X position in IHG coords

parameters.name: y
parameters.description: ---> V1 Y position in IHG coords
parameters.x_cdf_FIELDNAM: V1 Y position in IHG coords

parameters.name: z
parameters.description: ---> V1 Z position in IHG coords
parameters.x_cdf_FIELDNAM: V1 Z position in IHG coords

parameters.name: xvel
parameters.description: V1 X velocity in IHG coords
parameters.x_cdf_FIELDNAM: V1 X velocity in IHG coords

parameters.name: yvel
parameters.description: ---> V1 Y velocity in IHG coords
parameters.x_cdf_FIELDNAM: V1 Y velocity in IHG coords

parameters.name: zvel
parameters.description: ---> V1 Z velocity in IHG coords
parameters.x_cdf_FIELDNAM: V1 Z velocity in IHG coords

parameters.name: scDistance
parameters.description: V1 distance from the Sun

parameters.name: scLon
parameters.description: ---> V1 longitude in IHG coords = asin(Z/R)

parameters.name: scLat
parameters.description: ---> V1 latitude in IHG coords = asin(Z/R)

parameters.name: matrix1
parameters.description: Matrix1: transforms 3-element vector from Inertial Heliographic (IHG) to Heliographic (HG)coordinates.

parameters.name: matrix2
parameters.description: ---> Matrix2: transforms 3-element vector from Earth Mean ecliptic, Equinox of 1950 (EME 50) to Heliographic (HG) coordinates.

parameters.name: matrix3
parameters.description: ---> Matrix3: transforms 3-element vector from payload coordinates to Heliographic (HG) coordinates.
